title: [QUESTION] Can we get a new nuget release?
body:
There have been plenty of great additions to this repo over the last year, but it's been almost 3 years since the last nuget package release.

Would it be possible to get another release?

comments.author: timvandenhof
comments.body: Would this also include [Skiasharp.Svg](https://www.nuget.org/packages/SkiaSharp.Svg/) which links to this repo and is over 4 years old? Might fix a few issues we have with rendering SVG's with mask/id.

comments.author: ryanalford-suzy
comments.body: @timvandenhof we ended up moving to using  https://github.com/wieslawsoltes/Svg.Skia. Seems the current library is pretty much depreciated, and the new library is not.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
The library that was in this repo is like a 3 color paint set compared to all the colors in the universe. Svg.Skia is pretty much the most complete SVG parsing library.

The library in this repo had a good run and did the basics, but it is time to embrace the work done by geniuses.
